Description: Cypriot mould-made terracotta figure fragment. Fragment of right hand (alignment uncertain) and drapery. Cypriot or Cilician fabric. Pale buff fabric with abundant sub angular glossy black and common white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Parallels from a sanctuary at Salamis, Cyprus, have been dated to the mid 5th and 4th century BC (Monloup 1994, 85-7, pl.18, nos 224, 233). Jh.11.105 written on body. Monloup, T. 1994. Salamine de Chypre XIV. Les Terres Cuites Classiques. Un Sanctuaire de la Grande Déesse. Paris.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DA.097) (Phase 1)
